meanings.definition: A unit of energy equal to one watt of power expended for one hour.
meanings.sent1: I measured the energy consumption of the light bulb in watthours.
meanings.sent2: The solar panel produced 5 watthours of electricity in a day.
meanings.sent3: It only takes a few watthours to power a small fan for an entire day.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm was like a watthour, radiating energy constantly.
meanings.sent5: The watthours on the electricity bill showed a significant decrease this month.

meanings.definition: The amount of energy consumed by a device rated at one watt in one hour.
meanings.sent1: The battery capacity is measured in watthours.
meanings.sent2: The laptop consumes 30 watthours of energy per hour.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his phone battery was so low, it barely had a few watthours left.
meanings.sent4: The watthours drained quickly as the air conditioner ran all day.
meanings.sent5: The watthours used by the refrigerator were higher than expected.
